name: Parikrama Marg Vrindavan
history: Vrindavan Parikrama is a 10.5 km sacred walk around the holy town, covering ancient temples, Yamuna ghats, and places where Shri Krishna performed his divine pastimes.

name: Govardhan Parikrama
history: Govardhan Parikrama is one of the most famous routes (21 km) around Govardhan Hill, which Lord Krishna lifted to protect Brajwasis from Indra’s wrath.

name: Barsana Parikrama
history: Barsana, the birthplace of Shri Radha Rani, has an 8 km Parikrama that passes through temples, sacred ponds, and streets famous for the Lathmar Holi festival.

name: Nandgaon Parikrama
history: Nandgaon is the home of Nanda Baba, where Lord Krishna spent his childhood. The Parikrama covers temples and offers panoramic views of Braj.

name: Radha Kund – Shyam Kund Parikrama
history: Radha Kund and Shyam Kund are the most sacred ponds in Braj, believed to have been formed by Radha and Krishna themselves. The Parikrama is short but highly revered.

name: Mathura City Parikrama
history: Mathura, the birthplace of Lord Krishna, has a Parikrama route that covers Janmabhoomi temple, Dwarkadhish, Vishram Ghat, and other ancient shrines.
